page.title: 13SHOPPING: WARLEY, ESSEX
page.content: The main shopping area in the block is a small{precinct}opposite the Ford Offices at Warley, containing a bank, a laundrette, a take-away food joint, a butchers, a newsagent, an off-licence, a hardware shop and a small supermarket/general store. The general appearance is windswept and untidy, a design better confined to the architect's drawing board. A questionnaire survey of shoppers in May showed that most users travelled less than a mile to get to the centre, they mostly went there between two and three times a week, the vast majority coming on foot. Most used it because of its{convenience}to where they either lived or worked. In spite of the car park, few were attracted to the centre by it. The most frequent criticism was the lack of choice of goods, together with the appearance.
